subject: Deaths (Obituaries)
Hockey, Ice
Coaches and Managers
lead_paragraph: Arbour, who played in the N.H.L. as a defenseman, took over the Islanders in 1973, after they lost 60 games, and led them to four consecutive Stanley Cup titles, from 1980 to 1983.
snippet: Arbour, who played in the N.H.L. as a defenseman, took over the Islanders in 1973, after they lost 60 games, and led them to four consecutive Stanley Cup titles, from 1980 to 1983.
